ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, This course exposes you to a wide variety of topics and also helps to develop critical writing skills
Great first year class and a great way to familiarize yourself with the department as a whole!

Good course, but very demanding and tough. The work you put into it is the learning you get out of it, but the skills a student learns in this course stays with them forever. feedback from TAs was much appreciated and most helpfulWould recommend this course to all scientists just starting out

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Although I don't feel I gained a huge depth of knowledge in any topic from this class, I do feel I was exposed to a broad range of techniques and approaches to neuroscience that have influenced the way I think about designing experiments.

Most helpful course I have ever taken in deepening knowledge of neuroscience research. The skills I learned to constantly question findings and assumptions were invaluable.I wish this course were preceded by an introductory course to neuroscience, however, so I could be more prepared to take on reading those often dense science papers
